text: Athletes from Burma competed at the 1988 Summer Olympics in Seoul, South Korea. The nation sent a small delegation of two athletes and three officials. A military coup occurred in Burma during 8888 Uprising, the day after the Games' opening ceremony. Burma's athletes competed nonetheless, but the country was then absent from the 1988 Summer Paralympics, held just after the Olympics.Burma at the Paralympics, International Paralympic Committee == Athletics== ;Women ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Quarterfinal !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |- style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Khin Khin Htwe |align=left|1500 m |4:20.92 |23 |align=center colspan="6" |Did not advance |- align=center |3000 m |9:26.57 |29 |align=center colspan="6" |Did not advance |- align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Mar Mar Min |10,000 m |colspan="2"|DNS |align=center colspan="6" |Did not advance |- align=center |Marathon |colspan=6 |align=center colspan="2" |DNF |} ==References== * Category:Nations at the 1988 Summer Olympics 1988 Olympics
